item.title: Cyber Insights 2026: Malware and Cyberattacks in the Age of AI
item.dc:creator: Kevin Townsend
item.description:
Security leaders share how artificial intelligence is changing malware, ransomware, and identity-led intrusions, and how defenses must evolve.

The post Cyber Insights 2026: Malware and Cyberattacks in the Age of AI appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Over 1,400 MongoDB Databases Ransacked by Threat Actor
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Of 3,100 unprotected MongoDB instances, half remain compromised, most of them by a single threat actor.

The post Over 1,400 MongoDB Databases Ransacked by Threat Actor appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Microsoft Moves Closer to Disabling NTLM
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
The next major Windows Server and Windows releases will have the deprecated authentication protocol disabled by default.

The post Microsoft Moves Closer to Disabling NTLM appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Japan, Britain to Boost Cybersecurity and Critical Minerals Cooperation as China’s Influence Grows
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
Japan and Britain agree to accelerate cooperation on cybersecurity and the supply of critical minerals, as China’s influence grows in the region.

The post Japan, Britain to Boost Cybersecurity and Critical Minerals Cooperation as China’s Influence Grows appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Notepad++ Supply Chain Hack Conducted by China via Hosting Provider
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
The likely state-sponsored threat actor had access to the hosting provider for months and targeted only certain Notepad++ customers.

The post Notepad++ Supply Chain Hack Conducted by China via Hosting Provider appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: eScan Antivirus Delivers Malware in Supply Chain Attack
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Hackers compromised a MicroWorld Technologies update server and fed a malicious file to eScan customers.

The post eScan Antivirus Delivers Malware in Supply Chain Attack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: In Other News: Paid for Being Jailed, Google’s $68M Settlement, CISA Chief’s ChatGPT Leak
item.dc:creator: SecurityWeek News
item.description:
Other noteworthy stories that might have slipped under the radar: Apple updates platform security guide, LastPass detects new phishing wave, CISA withdraws from RSA Conference.

The post In Other News: Paid for Being Jailed, Google’s $68M Settlement, CISA Chief’s ChatGPT Leak appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Aisy Launches Out of Stealth to Transform Vulnerability Management
item.dc:creator: Kevin Townsend
item.description:
Aisy has emerged from stealth mode with $2.3 million in seed funding for its AI-assisted platform.

The post Aisy Launches Out of Stealth to Transform Vulnerability Management appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: 175,000 Exposed Ollama Hosts Could Enable LLM Abuse
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Among them, 23,000 hosts were persistently responsible for the majority of activity observed over 293 days of scanning.

The post 175,000 Exposed Ollama Hosts Could Enable LLM Abuse appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: White House Scraps ‘Burdensome’ Software Security Rules
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Two Biden-era memorandums have been revoked, but some of the resources they provide can still be used by government organizations. 

The post White House Scraps ‘Burdensome’ Software Security Rules  appeared first on SecurityWeek.
